thread.title: Democratic presidential debate: Live updates on Hillary Clinton, Bernie Sanders and more
thread.title_full: Democratic presidential debate: Live updates on Hillary Clinton, Bernie Sanders and more | syracuse.com

author: Jameson Fleming | jfleming@syracuse.com
title: Democratic presidential debate: Live updates on Hillary Clinton, Bernie Sanders and more
text:
The Democratic Party will hold its first debate for the 2016 presidential election featuring Hillary Clinton, Bernie Sanders and more on Tuesday night.
Unlike the crowded Republican debates, the Democrats will only have five candidates on the stage. The candidates are: Former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton, Vermont Senator Bernie Sanders, former Maryland Governor Martin O'Malley, former Virginia Senator Jim Webb, and former Rhode Island Governor Lincoln Chafee.
Debate coverage begins on CNN at 8:30 p.m. ET. Candidates will take the stage to debate at 9:00 p.m.
>>How you can watch the 2016 Democratic Presidential Debate
According to a survey of seven major polls on Real Clear Politics , Clinton leads the race with 43 percent of the vote with Sanders trailing with 25.1 percent. That gap was once as large as 55 percent, but Sanders has closed the lead to as little as 13 percent.
O'Malley, Webb and Chafee are all polling at less than one percent, making Tuesday an opportunity for them to gain exposure to voters.
Vice President Joe Biden, who has yet to declare his intentions to run for president and will not participate in Tuesday night's debate, polls at 17 percent. CNN reportedly has an extra lectern ready for Biden in case he makes a last minute announcement to run and wants to participate in Tuesday's debate.
Time.com reports there are 7 key issues that could be up for debate Tuesday night: Wall Street reform, gun control, minimum wage, Social Security, the TPP, health care, and Iraq War.
Follow along below for the latest updates and analysis from Tuesday night's debate.
[ View the story "Democratic Presidential Debate: Live updates" on Storify ]
